JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;George Nicolaou;Lech Garlicki;Ledi Bianku;Päivi Hirvelä;Vincent A. De Gaetano;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , ORG , née GPE , is an NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . She was represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their then Agent , PERSON of ORG .
CARDINAL . NORP The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . NORP On DATE ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) recognised the existence of the applicant ’s father ’s property rights over a plot of land measuring QUANTITY . m situated in the city of GPE ( vendim vërtetim fakti ) . On an unspecified date , a CARDINAL - storey building was constructed on that plot of land , including the bar - restaurant “ DATE ” , located on the ground floor .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the President of the then ORG made a request for supervisory review in respect of the decision of DATE . On DATE ORG decided to quash that decision on the ground that a thorough investigation had not been conducted by the lower court , and remitted the case for fresh examination . On CARDINAL DATE , following a request for interpretation , the then ORG ruled that its decision of CARDINAL DATE had not had any effect on the outcome of the proceedings decided by way of the ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .
CARDINAL . It would appear that the rehearing proceedings were dismissed by ORG on an unspecified date , following the applicant ’s loss of interest in the case .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG on ORG and Compensation of Properties ( GPE i GPE dhe PERSON Pronave – “ the Commission ” ) recognised the Ks’ ( third parties ) inherited property title to a plot of land measuring CARDINAL sq . m ( “ Commission decision no . CARDINAL ” ) , including the right to first refusal on the premises of the bar - restaurant “ DATE ” .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the PERSON requested ORG to recognise their property title to the plot of land on which the “ DATE ” had been built . On DATE ORG , relying on its decision of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) , dismissed their claim . It annulled Commission decision no . CARDINAL and recognised the applicant ’s and her GPE property rights over the plot of QUANTITY m. On an unspecified date the GPE appealed .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld ORG decision recognising the applicant ’s and her ORG title to the plot of QUANTITY m. However , it quashed the part of ORG decision that had annulled Commission decision no . CARDINAL , in so far as the Commission had not been invited as a party to the proceedings . On an unspecified date the GPE appealed to ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed both lower courts’ decisions . Deciding on the facts , it dismissed the Ks’ complaints in the light of their withdrawal from the case . The Commission decision of CARDINAL DATE thus became enforceable .

CARDINAL . Interpreting ORG decision of DATE as having recognised the applicant and her ORG property title to the plot of land , on DATE the ORG recognised the applicant ’s and her ORG inherited property title to QUANTITY . m ( “ Commission decision no . CARDINAL ” ) , including the right to first refusal in respect of the premises of the “ DATE ” . On DATE the applicant ’s siblings , by means of a contract of donation , donated their equal shares in the land to the applicant .

CARDINAL . On DATE a contract of sale was concluded between a ORG - owned company , ORG , ORG , ( “ the ORG ” ) , and the applicant , whereby the latter acquired the premises of the “ DATE ” for CARDINAL NORP leks ( ALL ) .
CARDINAL . NORP The applicant was also issued with a certificate of registration of property ( no . CARDINAL ) by ORG , dated DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE lodged a complaint with ORG requesting the annulment of Commission decision no . CARDINAL . It appears from the file that the applicant was not a party to these proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decision no . CARDINAL . Relying on ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) , it found that Commission decision no . CARDINAL had been issued in breach of the law as the applicant ’s property rights had been quashed . ORG further noted that since the applicant had failed to pursue the application following the remittal of her case by virtue of ORG decision of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) , it had dismissed the proceedings .
This decision became final , no appeal having been filed against it .

CARDINAL . In the light of the invalidity of Commission decision no . CARDINAL , on DATE the ORG and the PERSON filed a complaint with ORG against the contract of sale , alleging that it was null and void .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG annulled the contract of sale , relying on the same reasoning as in the decision of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . It decided that the amount paid , indexed to take account of inflation , should be returned to the applicant . On DATE the applicant appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed ORG decision and remitted the case for re - examination by a different formation of that court , holding as follows :

“ In re - examining the case ORG should take into account any overlapping of the plots of land allocated by the Commission ’s decisions ... ORG should correctly identify the parties , summon the Commission and conduct a topographic study to look into and clarify the foregoing . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared Commission decision no . CARDINAL null and void . It also declared void the contract of sale and ordered the ORG to reimburse the sum paid by the applicant , indexed to take account of inflation . On an unspecified date the applicant appealed .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( “ the Court of Appeal ” ) quashed the ORG decision . It found that Commission decision no . CARDINAL was still in force as it had not been challenged before the domestic courts . No reference was made to the ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE ( see paragraph DATE above ) . The proceedings initiated by the GPE were dismissed . On an unspecified date the GPE lodged an appeal with ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed ORG decision and remitted the case for re - examination . It found that ORG had failed to rule on all of the Ks’ complaints .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld ORG decision of DATE . It found , inter alia , as follows :

“ ORG by a decision ... in DATE ... made an interpretation of the decision ... dated DATE . According to its interpretation , the plaintiffs’ [ the Ks’ ] withdrawal resulted from the fact that they had become the owners of the plot of land as a result of the Commission decision of DATE [ Commission decision No . CARDINAL ] .

ORG judgment of CARDINAL DATE did not recognise the right of property of the defendant [ i.e. the applicant ] and , as such , it could not serve as a property title on the basis of which the ORG could act .
The defendant argued that her property title was based on the ORG decision of DATE . However , this decision was quashed by ORG decision of DATE . ”
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal with ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , by a majority , upheld the decision . It confirmed that the applicant ’s right to property had not been recognised , finding that the Commission had not only committed procedural violations in awarding the property to the applicant , but had also misinterpreted the merits of the applicant ’s case . ORG ordered that the sum paid by the applicant should be reimbursed in accordance with the terms of the decision of ORG of CARDINAL DATE . On DATE the applicant filed a constitutional complaint with ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared the applicant ’s complaint inadmissible , finding that it did not raise any breaches of the right to a fair hearing .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG ordered that the amount of ALL CARDINAL be returned to the applicant pursuant to the DATE ORG judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant informed the ORG in writing that the judgment had been enforced on an unspecified date . No supporting documents were submitted by the applicant , despite the ORG ’s request to do so in their letter of CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed an application with ORG for review of its decision of DATE in the light of new evidence and facts . She complained , inter alia , in the light of a letter from ORG and Tourism , that CARDINAL of the CARDINAL experts who had prepared the experts’ report had not been licensed by the authorities .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected that application . It made reference to the previous court rulings , outlined the reasons for the applicant ’s request for review and concluded that the request did not comply with LAW ( see “ Relevant domestic law ” below ) . Judge PERSON , who had also been in the majority which had ruled against the applicant in ORG decision of decision of DATE , was a member of the bench .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a constitutional appeal .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant renewed her request for review .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected it as being substantially the same as the previous request .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared the applicant ’s complaint inadmissible , finding that the issues raised fell within the jurisdiction of the lower courts .

CARDINAL . By a letter of CARDINAL DATE the applicant informed ORG that she had brought proceedings against the ORG for reimbursement of expenses incurred in the maintenance and renovation of the bar - restaurant “ ORG ” .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE ORG and ORG , respectively , ruled in favour of the applicant . The parties have not provided copies of the NORP decisions . However , an appeal before ORG appears to be currently pending .
CARDINAL . The relevant parts of LAW read as follows :
“ Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL

In the protection of his constitutional and legal rights , freedoms and interests , or in defending a criminal charge , everyone has the right to a fair and public hearing , within a reasonable time , by an independent and impartial court established by law . ”
“ Article CARDINAL

The Constitutional Court shall determine : ... ( f ) complaints by individuals alleging a violation of their constitutional rights to a fair hearing , provided all legal remedies for the protection of those rights have been exhausted . ”
“ Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL
State bodies shall comply with judicial judgments . ”

CARDINAL . Articles CARDINAL - CARDINAL of the ORG govern the review of court judgments . Article CARDINAL provides that the review of a final decision may occur , inter alia , when : ( a ) new circumstances or new written evidence which are important to the case , which could not have been known to the party during the proceedings , are discovered ; or ( b ) it is proved that ORG statements or experts’ opinions on which the decision is based were false .

CARDINAL . Under LAW ORG a request for review is submitted within DATE of the date on which the requesting party had knowledge of the ground for review and , in any case , not DATE from the date on which the ground for review came into existence . LAW ORG states that an inadmissibility decision on the request for revision is taken by ORG without the parties being present .
